Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods

Class GodStrategy

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.GodStrategy
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Demeter, Eros, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Minotaur, Pan, Poseidon, Prometheus, Zeus
public abstract class GodStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
This is the abstract class all the gods must extend in order to be playable in the game. This abstract class allows the use of Strategy Pattern, the God only knows it has a GodStrategy, but it is at runtime that the right God powers are actually used. The game turn can be divided in 2 main phases: Move and Build. These phases must be checked before execution, and each god may implement specific behaviors to both check and execute these operations. However, standard check and execute actions are implemented in Worker class and called as standard actions, allowing the Gods to also "decorate" the standard flow of the game.

    • NAME

      public final java.lang.String NAME

    • DESCRIPTION

      public final java.lang.String DESCRIPTION

    • POWER_DESCRIPTION

      public final java.lang.String POWER_DESCRIPTION

    • selectedWorker

      protected Worker selectedWorker
      This property is useful for all Gods and it's used to keep track of the selected Worker by a Player regarding the current turn. In fact, the standard flow imposes that the Player must use the same Worker for both Moving and Building phases. However, with this implementation, this behaviours is flexible and can be customized by Gods, if needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • GodStrategy

      protected GodStrategy​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String powerDescription)

  • Method Details

    • instantiateGod

      public static GodStrategy instantiateGod​(java.lang.String god)
      This method uses GodsUtils factory method to return a GodStrategy instance.
      Parameters:
      god - String representation of the God to instantiate
      Returns:
      The GodStrategy instance
      See Also:
      GodsUtils.godsFactory(String)

    • isUsingSelectedWorker

      protected boolean isUsingSelectedWorker​(Worker worker)
      Checks if the Worker passed is the selected Worker for the current turn.
      Parameters:
      worker - The Worker to compare to the selected Worker
      Returns:
      true if worker is the selected Worker, false otherwise.

    • checkGamePreparation

      public boolean checkGamePreparation​(Worker workerFirst, Cell workerFirstCell, Worker workerSecond, Cell workerSecondCell)
      This method is called once a match (for every player), to check if game preparation constraints (if present) are satisfied. The standard behavior is that no constraints are imposed to the game preparation phase. The gods that have a particular Game preparation behavior will override this method.
      Parameters:
      workerFirst - the first Worker placed
      workerFirstCell - the position of the first Worker placed
      workerSecond - the second Worker placed
      workerSecondCell - the position of the second Worker placed
      Returns:
      true if the Workers can be placed in the positions specified, false otherwise.

    • checkGamePreparationConstraints

      public boolean checkGamePreparationConstraints​(Worker workerFirst, Cell workerFirstCell, Worker workerSecond, Cell workerSecondCell)
      This method is called once a match (for every player), to check if game preparation constraints from other Player's Gods (if present) are satisfied. The standard behavior is that no constraints are imposed to the game preparation phase. The gods that impose particular Game preparation constraints will override this method. However, in this version, there are not Gods which set Game Preparation constraints.
      Parameters:
      workerFirst - the first Worker placed
      workerFirstCell - the position of the first Worker placed
      workerSecond - the second Worker placed
      workerSecondCell - the position of the second Worker placed
      Returns:
      true if the Workers can be placed in the positions specified, false otherwise.

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      This method is called at every turn before executing the worker's movement. It checks if the move which the player requested to do is allowed. It can be extended by Gods which alter the standard movement rules.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      true if the move passed as parameter can be performed, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      Worker.standardCheckMove(Cell)

    • checkBuild

      public boolean checkBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      This method is called at every turn before executing the worker's build phase. It checks if the build action which the player requested to do is allowed. It can be extended by Gods which alter the standard build rules.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who want to build a new level.
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.
      Returns:
      true if the Build passed as parameter can be performed, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      Worker.standardCheckBuild(Cell, BlockType)

    • checkEndTurn

      public boolean checkEndTurn()
      This method is called once a turn, to check if end turn constraints are satisfied. The standard behavior is that a Player must move AND build with the selected worker in order to end the turn. The gods that have a particular end turn behavior will override this method.
      Returns:
      true if the turn can be ended now, false otherwise.

    • checkEndTurnConstraints

      public boolean checkEndTurnConstraints​(Player player)
      This method is called once a turn, to check if end turn constraints from other Player's Gods (if present) are satisfied. The standard behavior is that there are no constraints other than those imposed by checkEndTurn. The gods that impose particular End Turn constraints will override this method. However, in this version, there are not Gods which set End Turn constraints.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that wants to end its turn.
      Returns:
      true if the turn can be ended now, false otherwise.

    • executeGamePreparation

      public void executeGamePreparation​(Worker workerFirst, Cell workerFirstCell, Worker workerSecond, Cell workerSecondCell)
      This method is called once a match (for every player), to execute the game preparation phase and respect the god's constraints. The gods that have a particular Game preparation behavior will override this method.
      Parameters:
      workerFirst - the first Worker placed
      workerFirstCell - the position of the first Worker placed
      workerSecond - the second Worker placed
      workerSecondCell - the position of the second Worker placed

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      This is the methods used to execute a movement action (change a worker's position). It can be extended by Gods which alter the standard move action.

      It also sets the current selected Worker for the Player (normal flow implies that a Worker first moves, then builds a block)

      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.

    • executeBuild

      public void executeBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      This is the method used to execute a build action (change a cell level). It can be extended by Gods which alter the standard build action.

      Setting the selectedWorker is necessary for Gods, like Prometheus, that can build BEFORE moving. In that case the next move has to be performed with the same worker that built a level. [NO]

      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who want to build a new level.
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.

    • endPlayerTurn

      public void endPlayerTurn​(Player player)
      This is the method used to execute actions at the end of player's turn. At least it's necessary to reset all flags of the Player Workers that are used to check if a Worker has moved or built a block.
      Parameters:
      player - Player corresponding to the current turn.
      See Also:
      Worker.reinitializeBuiltMoved()

    • onTurnStarted

      public void onTurnStarted​(Player player)
      This method is a callback which is called every time the player's turn starts.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player whose turn just started

    • checkMoveConstraints

      public boolean checkMoveConstraints​(Worker oppositeWorker, Cell moveCell)
      This is the method used to check if there are movement constraints imposed by other Players that don't permit the Worker to execute a particular movement. So it's different from checkMove method because that method does not consider possible actions prevented by other God powers. However, the standard behavior is that there are not additional constraints besides standard and God-specific checkMove().
      Parameters:
      oppositeWorker - Worker whose movement could be prevented by God's power
      moveCell - The cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      true if no constraint prevent the move passed as parameter, false otherwise.

    • checkBuildConstraints

      public boolean checkBuildConstraints​(Worker oppositeWorker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      This is the method used to check if there are build constraints imposed by other Players that don't permit the Worker to execute a particular building action. So it's different from checkBuild method because that method does not consider possible actions prevented by other God powers. However, the standard behavior is that there are not additional constraints besides standard and God-specific checkBuild().
      Parameters:
      oppositeWorker - Worker whose building action could be prevented by God's power
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.
      Returns:
      true if no constraint prevent the move passed as parameter, false otherwise.

    • checkWinConstraints

      public boolean checkWinConstraints​(Worker oppositeWorker, Cell moveCell)
      This is the method used to check if there are win constraints imposed by other Players that don't permit the Worker to win under certain conditions. So it's different from checkWinCondition method because that method does not consider possible win conditions prevented by other God powers. However, the standard behavior is that there are not additional constraints besides standard and God-specific checkBuild().
      Parameters:
      oppositeWorker - Worker whose win could be prevented by God's power
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player moved the selected Worker.
      Returns:
      true if no constraint prevent the Worker to win, false otherwise.

    • checkWinCondition

      public boolean checkWinCondition​(Worker worker)
      This is the method used check if the Player has won in the current turn (it's called after executeMove and executeBuild). It can be extended by the Gods that have additional Win Condition powers
      Parameters:
      worker - Player's selected Worker corresponding to the current turn.
      Returns:
      true if Worker's position level is 3 and it comes from level 2 (standard Win Condition triggered), false otherwise.

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(Board board, Player player)
      This method is called to check if a player can move to any adjacent Cell. It's useful to check if a Player lost when its turn starts.
      Parameters:
      board - the Match board to consider
      player - the player whose ability to move is about to be tested
      Returns:
      true if the Player passed by parameter has an adjacent available Cell to move to, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      canBuild(Board, Worker)

    • canBuild

      public boolean canBuild​(Board board, Worker worker)
      This method is called to check if a worker can build to any adjacent Cell. It's useful to check if a Player lost after a move.
      Parameters:
      board - the Match board to consider
      worker - the worker whose ability to build is about to be tested
      Returns:
      true if the Worker passed by parameter has an adjacent buildable Cell, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      canBuild(Board, Worker)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Classic "equals" overridden version, used to check if two GodStrategy instances are equals.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to be compared to this
